member_organisations: Balcas, Enniskillen, Co Fermanagh; Coolrain Sawmills, Coolrain, Portlaoise, Co Laois; ECC Timber Products, Corr na Mona, Co Galway; Glennon Brothers,  Dublin Road, Co Longford & Fermoy, Co Cork; GP Wood, Enniskeane, Co Cork; Laois Sawmills, Drumsna, Carrick-on-Shannon, Co Leitrim; Murray Timber Group, Ballygar, Co Galway & Ballon, Co Carlow and Woodfab Timber, Tinnakilly, Aughrim, Co Wicklow
fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Trade, Customs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Single market, Regional Policy, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Climate Action, Borders and Security
eu_initiatives: The TIBF is primarily engaged in awareness raising through various meetings, events and printed reports related to Brexit
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
relevant_communication:
The TIBF will meet with the MEPs in the European Parliament, officials in the European Commission's Task Force 50 as well as the Secretariat of the Task Force on the UK in the Council of the European Union on June 27, 2018 to present a publication on Brexit;  
Launch and promotion of expert reports among key stakeholders
goals__remit: To raise awareness of the importance of the Timber Industry in Ireland along with the significant threats that Brexit presents for the industry, and to develop strategies that will minimise the negative impact of Brexit on the industry
